title: Casillero del Diablo "clean" and legible blackletter
content:
Hei!

I'm looking for this typeface or any other highly legible blackletter resembling it.

Suggestions?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131219060327im_/http:/typophile.com/files/casillero_del_diablo_4038.jpg)
author: oystein

comments.content: Sorry for interruption; what do you mean with "highly legible blackletter"? Something more "Latin" looking, or s.th. like a simplified version of this particular blackletter style?

Well, I find many blackletters have a lot of ornamentation, while this one is pretty clean e.g. highly legible – so something down this alley if it is custom.

Thanks for reply!

Thanks Stephen, but it does not resemble the face shown above.  
I'll keep looking!
You won't find a match because it's hand lettered.

Hey, James, your comment sent me Googling, and I found [this story about Carménère in Chile](http://web.archive.org/web/20131219060327/http:/www.houstonwine.com/carmenere_grape.htm)... Veddy eenteresting! Thanks!

I'm a big fan of the Concha y Toro Cabernet, but I've tried the Merlot a couple of times as well. Now I will go looking for the Carménère... :-)

Paul Lloyd's Germanica is not as "clean" as your sample, but it is pretty readable.

[http://moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lloyd/blackjewels/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131219060327/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lloyd/blackjewels/index.htm "http://moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lloyd/blackjewels/index.htm")

There about two dozen more blackletter fonts at the site.

You might also want to browse [Part 3 of the Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131219060327/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script03Pg1.html) for a large selection of blackletter font samples. Just on the first page, Caligra and Brunnhilde might fit your criteria.

- Mike Yanega
